Subjective: Spot on neck, swollen and redder. Scabs have fallen off. Itches. Possible reaction to insect bite. Pinkish-red color. Raised, about half a centimeter. Slightly redder spot in the middle. Flaking. Half-scab forms and falls off. No fever, cough, or shortness of breath. No pain. No similar spots elsewhere on skin. Worried about skin cancer. Wants to get rid of the spot. Asks about different methods for removal.
Objective: Vitals: not recorded. Physical Exam: spot on neck, swollen and redder, scabs have fallen off, itches, possible reaction to insect bite, pinkish-red color, raised, about half a centimeter, slightly redder spot in the middle, flaking, half-scab forms and falls off.
Assessment: Possible pyogenic granuloma or atypical mole. Will send picture to dermatologist for further evaluation.
Plan: Will send picture to dermatologist via e-consultation.
Will call patient on Friday between 12-1:30 PM to discuss dermatologist's advice.
Possible options for removal: freezing, scraping device, or complete removal with skin biopsy.
Patient will be reachable on Friday, or can use cell phone to leave voicemail if not available.
